intro: Graffenrieda calyptrelloides, commonly known as the velvetleaf graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant's ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
